moves.1. e3: The second game between me and brianmahagio - he beat me last time so I'm out for payback here.
moves.1... e5 2. Bc4: Trying to get him with 4 move checkmate, probably not going to work... but worth a shot.
moves.2... d5: Already foiled, but both of these pawns out like this leaving the king open probably not too good either.
moves.3. Bb3 Bc5 4. Qf3: Still trying on 4 move checkmate... probably a mistake in retrospect.
moves.5... Bg4 6. Qg3 Qd6: Moves his queen out... not too sure what he's trying to do with that.
moves.7. Nb5: Threaten the queen - disrupt whatever it is he's doing.
moves.7... Qe7 8. c3 Nh5: Again, trying to assail my queen.
moves.9. Qxg4: But the bishop is no longer protected so that happens.
moves.9... Nf6 10. Qxg7: Moving my queen right into his ranks. Can take the rook, but he can save it and threaten queen at same time
moves.10... c6: Not the best move, but trying to threaten knight here
moves.11. Qxh8+: But a knight is worth a rook, - also, he's in check which buys me time to save the knight
moves.11... Kd7 12. Nf3: But I decide to move this knight out instead, so I can castle.
moves.12... cxb5: He takes the knight. Big suprise.
moves.14. Ng5 a5: Opening up a path for the rook -  cant move knight else Queen would take the rook.
moves.15. d4: Force his bishop to move - also deadlocking centre pawns.
moves.15... Bd6 16. f3: Trying to coax him into takingpawn, so rook can move out to take knight - while being protected by queen
moves.16... a4: Doesn't take it... threatens bishop instead.
moves.17. Bc2 b6: No idea what he was trying to do there.
moves.18... dxe4 19. Rxf6: Knight taken - rook now operating from a central position - good position to trap king later.
moves.19... Nc6: Moves his knight... exposing queen to rook, but I dont notice this...
moves.20. Nxf7: instead moving my knight to take a pawn...
moves.20... Rxh8: he takes my queen. A big mistake on my part.
moves.21. Rf5: Moving rook since it is no longer protected from queen.
moves.23. Rf2 Rf8 24. Raf1: Both rooks on same file... preparing for further aggressive moves.
moves.24... h5: I think he was trying to expose my castled king by forcing me to take a pawn. I saw this coming and pressed to attack to prevent him from capatilising on this.
moves.27. Nxd6+: ...because now I fork his king and queen. He must move the king so...
moves.27... Kd7 28. Nxe8: ...I take his queen. At which point he resigned, which was probably for the best. I had a substantial material advantage and coul of easily moved to trap the king with the 2 rooks, or promoted a pawn to queen and done it with that.
